intro: Austroeupatorium albescens, commonly known as white boneset, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist, sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Austroeupatorium albescens is often found in disturbed or swampy habitats and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
